Summary I have extensive experience in Semiconductor Manufacturing data extraction and analysis for both relational (SQL Server, Oracle and Teradata) and non-relational / hybrid database storage. I have personally designed, developed, deployed and supported a Windows based application "CB"​ used internationally across all Intel Fab and Assembly Test sites. "CB"​ has a user base of over 5000 users and has been developed and supported since 1997. I have personally designed, developed, deployed and supported a hybrid data storage solution "NEB"​ for 'sort'​ and 'electrical'​ test that continues to outperform the POR Oracle corporate solution in size, cost and performance. "NEB"​ is installed at all 300mm Intel manufacturing sites. I have personally designed, developed, deployed and supported a remote extraction service "ADS"​ for relational databases that can provide one to two orders of magnitude increase in ODBC performance for world wide data extraction. "ADS"​ is installed at all Intel Fab and Assembly test sites and is used extensively by "CB" to provide high performance remote extractions. I am self driven and disciplined - from 1997 to 2011, my supervisor was in a different state that I was as I developed and expanded the above applications. 
 
I am interested in all aspects of data storage, extraction and analysis of big data sets.

 Experience Sr Staff Engineer Intel Corporation Sr Staff Software Engineer Intel Corporation November 2011  – Present (3 years 10 months) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Continuing to support and develop application "CB"​ in C/C++/C# with user base exceeding 7000 users internationally. Development of next gen "NEB"​ hybrid data storage called "PULS"​. "PULS"​ provides incremental extraction from corporate classical relational databases and coverts to smaller / high performance hybrid storage. Development of indicator monitoring system (built on "PULS") for comparing weekly trends to prior trend looking for deviation.  Software Engineer Intel Corporation July 1997  –  July 2008  (11 years 1 month) Albuquerque, New Mexico Area Although 'stationed'​ in Albuquerque, my direct supervisor was in Santa Clara demonstrating high performance output with no direct supervision. 
 
Design, develop, and support of engineering data extraction/analysis application called "CB"​. "CB"​ began with 'class test'​ unit level data and expanded back into 'sort'​, 'electrical test'​ and 'fab'​ based data expanding into most manufacturing engineering data domains. 
 
Designed and developed SQL Server / hybrid data storage system "NEB"​ which outperformed corporate POR classical Oracle relational database in cost, size and performance. Improvements of 10x-100x over relational model was seen depending on data type. 
 
Designed and developed remote extraction engine - first on Open VMS and later on Windows Server. Engine provided 10x faster remote extractions of classical ODBC type connections. Integrated "ADS"​ extraction engine with "CB"​ and "NEB"​ for highest performance. 
 
Received two Intel Achievement Awards - the first as an individual contributor for the development of "CB"​. The second as part of a team for high density 'Intra Die' measurements.

Developed first version of data analysis application "CB"​ that parsed 'datalog' files directly and graphed results. - Technical lead for Ice Cream Sandwich on Medfield tablets resulting in on time SW delivery 
- Scrum master and engineer for ChromeOS on Haswell-ULT 
- Scrum Master and technical lead for Android on Haswell-ULT 
- Product Owner for Android-on-IA core engineering team 
 
After several years of technical leadership on OS-enabling work for a variety of platforms, I joined OTC's security team in July 2014 to spend more time as an individual contributor and develop some domain expertise in security. I am currently working on Android security features. Software Engineer Garmin International August 2008  –  April 2011  (2 years 9 months) I was a key contributor to the T-Mobile GarminFone project. I was the first Garmin Associate devoted full-time to the android platform and in over two years of working on this project I became an expert in the underlying android architecture, and was recognized as a talented problem solver and leader. My assignments ranged from application level problems all the way down to Kernel level problems. I was responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining a new Garmin API used on the android platform to access Garmin's existing codebase. I did the initial work to get maps drawing in native code over Binder using Android 0.9 (at this code level it was very non-trivial), I also developed a geo-spatial search engine optimized for use on a mobile device. After Garmin discontinued Android handsets, I worked on the Map Technologies team integrating the geo-spatial search into Garmin's Personal Navigation Device codebase.
